channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Canada ditches digital tax after tariff threat from Trump
item.description: Canada scrapped a digital services tax that would have hit U.S. tech companies such as Google and Amazon after President Trump halted trade talks and ...

item.title: Click, speak, move: These brain implants are poised to help people with disabilities
item.description: People who can no longer move or speak may soon have a new option: an implanted device that links their brain to a computer.

item.title: Trump DHS links data for new citizenship tracking tool. And, Senate discusses tax bill
item.description: The Trump administration is developing a searchable national citizenship data system, worrying some officials. And, the Senate focuses on the sweeping...

item.title: Federal investigation finds Harvard violated civil rights law
item.description: The Trump administration has issued a notice of violation accusing Harvard University of "deliberate indifference" toward Jewish and Israeli students.

item.title: The WNBA is expanding again, adding 3 new cities for a record 18 teams
item.description: The WNBA is adding three new teams: Cleveland will join in 2028, Detroit begins play in 2029 and Philadelphia will be added to the roster in 2030. Thi...

item.title: A man lured Idaho firefighters to a mountain with a fire then shot and killed 2, officials say
Boulder attack suspect faces murder charges after victim dies
item.description: The suspect in the June 1 attack on a march for Israeli hostages in Boulder, Colorado, will be charged with murder after one of the victims died.

item.title: 'Unprecedented' alerts in France as blistering heat grips Europe
item.description: Dozens of the country's mainland regions are currently under the second-highest alert as the heatwave continues.

item.title: Best debt relief companies, plus advice borrowers need to know now
item.description: These debt relief companies could help you slash your debt, but there are a few things to know before signing up.

item.title: Israeli strike on Gaza seafront cafe kills at least 20 Palestinians, witnesses and rescuers say
item.description: The outdoor cafe was frequently used by journalists, activists and local residents.

item.title: Senate GOP tax bill could crush wind and solar power, advocates say
'A little bit melting': Intense heat across Europe
item.description: A new heat record for June of 46C was set in Spain this weekend as Europe experiences an intense heatwave.

item.title: Military requesting to pull 200 troops back from California protest duty
item.description: The top military commander in charge of troops deployed to Los Angeles to respond to protests against immigration raids has asked Defense Secretary Pe...

item.title: Senate holds "vote-a-rama" on Trump's "big, beautiful bill"
item.description: After debate on President Trump's massive tax bill stretched into early Monday, the Senate began a "vote-a-rama" on the "big, beautiful bill."

item.title: Government contractor charged with driving circles on National Mall
item.description: Prosecutors allege the June 21 incident caused approximately $10,000 in damage.

item.title: Police identify 20-year-old suspect in Idaho firefighter ambush
item.description: 20-year-old Wess Roley deliberately lit a fire to lure first responders to a mountainous area near Coeur d'Alene, the BBC's US partner CBS News report...

item.title: Key witness in ex-Peru mayor's corruption case found dead
item.description: José Miguel Castro was collaborating with prosecutors in the corruption case against Susana Villarán.

item.title: From rivers to college campuses, how these everyday heroes show up
item.description: This edition of "Dear David" shares the stories of Ed Bieber, a diver who recovered phones after a tragic accident, and two Louisiana students who sup...
